comment.body:
Did you unregister service worker?
If not, you may need do the following:
1. Unregister service worker using devtools (screenshot below), or you can try to use this rule:
```adblock
twitter.com#%#(()=>{navigator.serviceWorker.getRegistrations().then((function(e){for(let r of e)r.unregister()}));})();
```
<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/29142494/fb2fe03d-8747-4083-91c6-9bc1f4ea9b13)

</details>

(The previous rule `||twitter.com^$csp=worker-src 'none'` is still required)

2. Clear website cache or refresh website using <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>F5</kbd>, on macOS it's probably <kbd>Cmd </kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>R</kbd>

Now when you open link with tracking parameters it should be removed.
If it's still not removed, please try to manually remove cache for Twitter and restart web browser.
